Package com.yardi.ejb.model

Class Pwd_Policy

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yardi.ejb.model.Pwd_Policy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    @Entity
public class Pwd_Policy
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Entity implementation class for Entity: Pwd_Policy.

    Password policy is a set of rules established by the admin which control how a user logs in and changes their password. There is a single instance of password policy that is shared with clients. A client uses com.yardi.ejb.PasswordPolicyBean.getPwdPolicy() to get a reference to password policy. 

     Database table: PWD_POLICY
 Schema: DB2ADMIN
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ppDays

        private short ppDays
        Column: PP_DAYS

        Password life in days.

      • ppNbrUnique

        private short ppNbrUnique
        Column: PP_NBR_UNIQUE

        Enforce unique tokens. Enter a positive value to define the number of unique tokens to store per user. Enter zero if not enforcing unique tokens.

      • ppMaxSignonAttempts

        private short ppMaxSignonAttempts
        Column: PP_MAX_SIGNON_ATTEMPTS

        The allowed number of invalid password attempts since the most recent successful login. When the number of unsuccessful login attempts reaches this number, the user profile entity is disabled and the user cant login until an admin resets the password. Enter a value greater than zero.

      • ppPwdMinLen

        private short ppPwdMinLen
        Column: PP_PWD_MIN_LEN

        The minimum password length. Enter a value greater than zero to define the minimum password length.

      • ppUpperRqd

        private java.lang.Boolean ppUpperRqd
        Boolean representation of field pp_upper_rqd provided for convenience.

        Field ppUpperRqd is tested to determine whether at least one upper case character is required in the new password. Not stored in PWD_POLICY database table.

      • pp_upper_rqd

        private java.lang.String pp_upper_rqd
        Column: PP_UPPER_RQD

        Determines whether upper case characters are required in the new password. The y/n value of this field has a Boolean representation, ppUpperRqd, that is provided for convenience.

      • ppLowerRqd

        private java.lang.Boolean ppLowerRqd
        Boolean representation of field pp_lower_rqd provided for convenience.

        Field ppLowerRqd is tested to determine whether at least one lower case character is required in the new password. Not stored in PWD_POLICY database table.

      • pp_lower_rqd

        private java.lang.String pp_lower_rqd
        Column: PP_LOWER_RQD

        Determines whether lower case characters are required in the new password. The y/n value of this field has a Boolean representation, ppLowerRqd, that is provided for convenience.

      • ppNumberRqd

        private java.lang.Boolean ppNumberRqd
        Boolean representation of field pp_number_rqd provided for convenience.

        Field ppNumberRqd is tested to determine whether at least one number is required in the new password. Not stored in PWD_POLICY database table.

      • pp_number_rqd

        private java.lang.String pp_number_rqd
        Column: PP_NUMBER_RQD

        Indicates that at least one number is required in the new password.

        The y/n value of this field has a Boolean representation, ppNumberRqd, that is provided for convenience.

      • ppSpecialRqd

        private java.lang.Boolean ppSpecialRqd
        Boolean representation of field pp_special_rqd provided for convenience.

        Field ppSpecialRqd is tested to determine whether at least one special character is required in the new password. Not stored in PWD_POLICY database table.

      • pp_special_rqd

        private java.lang.String pp_special_rqd
        Column: PP_SPECIAL_RQD

        Determines whether special characters are required in the new password. The y/n value of this field has a Boolean representation, ppSpecialRqd, that is provided for convenience.

      • ppMaxPwdLen

        private java.lang.Short ppMaxPwdLen
        Column: PP_MAX_PWD_LEN

        Maximum length of new password. Set to null if this rule is not being enforced.

      • ppMaxRepeatChar

        private java.lang.Short ppMaxRepeatChar
        Column: PP_MAX_REPEAT_CHAR

        The maximum number of repeated characters allowed in the new password. Set to null if this rule is not being enforced.

      • ppNbrDigits

        private java.lang.Short ppNbrDigits
        Column: PP_NBR_DIGITS

        If digits are required in the new password, then new passwords must contain at least the number of digits defined by field ppNbrDigits.

        Set to null if this rule is not being enforced.

      • ppNbrUpper

        private java.lang.Short ppNbrUpper
        Column: PP_NBR_UPPER

        If upper case characters are required in the new password then new passwords must contain at least the number of upper case characters defined by field ppNbrUpper. Set to null if this rule is not being enforced.

      • ppNbrLower

        private java.lang.Short ppNbrLower
        Column: PP_NBR_LOWER

        If lower case characters are required in the new password then new passwords must contain at least the number of lower case characters defined by field ppNbrLower. Set to null if this rule is not being enforced.

      • ppNbrSpecial

        private java.lang.Short ppNbrSpecial
        Column: PP_NBR_SPECIAL

        If special characters are required in the new password then the new password must contain at least the number of special characters defined by field ppNbrSpecial. Set to null if this rule is not being enforced.

      • pp_cant_contain_id

        private java.lang.String pp_cant_contain_id
        Column: PP_CANT_CONTAIN_ID

        Determines whether the new password may contain the user ID in any case. The y/n value of this field has a Boolean representation, ppCantContainId, that is provided for convenience.

      • ppCantContainId

        private boolean ppCantContainId
        Boolean representation of field pp_cant_contain_id provided for convenience. Field ppCantContainId is tested to determine whether the new password may contain the user ID in any case. Not stored in PWD_POLICY database table.

      • pp_cant_contain_pwd

        private java.lang.String pp_cant_contain_pwd
        Column: PP_CANT_CONTAIN_PWD

        Determines whether the new password may contain the current password. The y/n value of this field has a Boolean representation, ppCantContainPwd, that is provided for convenience.

      • ppCantContainPwd

        private boolean ppCantContainPwd
        Boolean representation of field pp_cant_contain_pwd provided for convenience. Field ppCantContainPwd is tested to determine whether the new password may contain the current password. Not stored in PWD_POLICY database table.

      • ppRrn

        private java.lang.Long ppRrn
        Column: PP_RRN

        Primary key. Relative record number. Sequence is generated by the database.

                  java.lang.String pp_cant_contain_pwd)
        Constructor for constructing a Pwd_Policy instance that uses all columns of PWD_POLICY database table except PP_RRN.
        Parameters:
        ppDays - Password life in days
        ppNbrUnique - Enforce unique tokens
        ppMaxSignonAttempts - The allowed number of invalid password attempts since the most recent successful login
        ppPwdMinLen - The minimum password length
        pp_upper_rqd - Determines whether upper case characters are required in the new password
        pp_lower_rqd - Determines whether lower case characters are required in the new password
        pp_number_rqd - Determines whether digits are required in the new password
        pp_special_rqd - Determines whether special characters are required in the new password
        ppMaxPwdLen - Maximum length of new password
        ppMaxRepeatChar - The maximum number of repeated characters allowed in the new password
        ppNbrDigits - Defines the minimum number of digits required in the new password
        ppNbrUpper - Defines the minimum number of upper case characters required in the new password
        ppNbrLower - Defines the minimum number of lower case characters required in the new password
        ppNbrSpecial - Defines the minimum number of special characters required in the new password
        pp_cant_contain_id - Determines whether the new password may contain the user ID in any case
        pp_cant_contain_pwd - Determines whether the new password may contain the current password

      • setPp_cant_contain_id

        void setPp_cant_contain_id()
        Password cant contain user ID is set based on the value of field ppCantContainId.

        Set field pp_cant_contain_id to "y" if ppCantContainId is true.
        Set field pp_cant_contain_id to "n" if ppCantContainId is false.

      • setPp_cant_contain_id

        public void setPp_cant_contain_id​(java.lang.String pp_cant_contain_id)
        Password cant contain user ID is set to the given String.

        Also call setter for ppCantContainId because these two fields are closely related.

        Parameters:
        pp_cant_contain_id - the value to set

        void setPpCantContainId()
        Password cant contain user ID is set based on the value of field pp_cant_contain_id.

        Enforces password cant contain user ID.
        Set field ppCantContainId to true if pp_cant_contain_id is "y".
        Set field ppCantContainId to false if pp_cant_contain_id is "n".

      • setPpCantContainPwd

        void setPpCantContainPwd()
        New password cant contain current password is set based on the value of field pp_cant_contain_pwd.

        Enforces new password cant contain current password.
        Set field ppCantContainPwd to true if pp_cant_contain_pwd is "y".
        Set field ppCantContainPwd to false if pp_cant_contain_pwd is "n".
